Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad clue collection, cataloging diverse architectural and environmental features without a specific hypothesis

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying architectural clues to support the hypothesis of Southern Germany
Analyzing detailed environmental indicators to strengthen the regional hypothesis
Summarizing and confirming the regional hypothesis, preparing to pinpoint the neighborhood
Developing targeted search strategies using architectural references and language queries
Focusing queries on a specific candidate (Fishermen’s Quarter, Ulm) and detailed roofline and color features
Refining search terms based on potential locations and architectural details
Comparing the image with Google Street View to confirm precise location
Re-examining rooflines and house sequence in the image to improve search accuracy
Analyzing house alignment and image angles to refine area search queries
Final confirmation of location using the key arrangement and color palette

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Moved from broad, undirected clue collection to focused verification upon forming a regional hypothesis
